comment: Lotssssss of reading. He would give quizzes on the reading, but tell us to only read 2-3/5-6 articles. So the questions on the quiz could be something you didn't read. The questions were also very theoretical.
Professor Yen is a very cool teacher, but be prepared to read a lot and discussions can sometimes confusing. There is a midterm paper and exam.

Professor Rodriguez was very good. The only thing that he needs to work on is replying to emails. Sometimes I would get a response back after the fact. But everything is laid out for you. One quiz every week and a discussion post. So the class definitely didnt take up much of my time. He is a very cool professor. Take him! I got an A :)
rating_tags: Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT--Get ready to read

comment: I enjoyed his class. He had great lectures (PowerPoints), but he never responded to any of my emails.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: I enjoyed this class, but he was bad at getting back to me. He never responded to any of my emails when I had questions. I just had to ask my group chat. He doesnt offer any extra credit but does drop the two lowest quiz grades. Gives plenty of time to turn in assignments.
Hes definitely a great teacher and its an easy grade. As long as you participate you will pass however the grading criteria is a little confusing .

I personally forgot a few assignments and he would reopen them! He is the most understanding professor. Really cool guy! As for the class- loved it learned a lot. Textbook is used but don't buy it. Free versions online. After this course, I made my minor AADS so that says it.
Took online but seems like a really cool person. Lots of reading though to pass your quizzes.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Hes amazing super sweet and understanding recommend

I took Professor Yens class online! He is an AMAZING professor! Although this class is definitely solely reading, theres no lockdown browser and tests + quizzes are always open book. Hes super sweet and will work with you if youre struggling! Highly recommend.

I took this class all online due to covid and I would highly recommend it online. You have a quiz and discussion due by the end of the week every week. Questions come from the PowerPoints. Some discussions are harder but it's participation that matters!  Easy and doesn't cause alot of stress.

Professor Rodriguez is one of the best professors at KSU. He is caring and very understanding more than the other professors that I've had. His lectures and assignments are interesting. He does have weekly discussions and quizzes each week, but if you do the reading, you will be fine. He's a 10/10. Take him if you can!!

He's SUPER chill. Very willing to open assignments up for you if asked and extend due dates for you. Class wasn't in person but posted weekly lecture videos along with a quiz and discussion post due every week. Midterm essay and test. Case Study and Final Exam.

Weekly reading quizzes. If you put in the effort the class will not be that bad. This class also does require a lot of reading. If you do the reading the quizzes aren't that bad. You also have a weekly discussion due each week.
He is such a good professor who actually cares. If you do the readings quizzes and participate you will be fine. 100% recommend.

Easiest professor at kennesaw. Grades easy as long as you do your work he'll bump you up. 10 quizzes and discussions that are not bad shouldn't take long. You dont have to go to class to get an A. I would take this class.

Mr. Rodriguez was a phenomenal professor! He made learning about Latin America and its history very enjoyable and interesting. There are 10 quizzes and they are easy if you really read and understand the material he assigns. There are weekly discussions that only take 30 minutes or less of your time. One semester long group project, grades fair :)

This man is great, and I am so glad I took this class with this professor. He is so involved in what he is teaching and makes it known. He is dedicated to helping others out as well with the community and it just inspires me. His class is not hard till you get the hang of it. He has weekly online discussions and quizzes and you have to read!

I loved this class. He is an awesome professor, who truly cares about his students. The lectures are easy, with lots of cool videos. Some reading from textbook, and online tests. Two major projects, but they're group projects. Overall, if you complete everything and study it's super easy to get an A. I would definitely take again!

Yen is hands down the best professor. The class itself was easy, but he made it easier by explaining everything clearly and teaching in terms in which we can relate. He's really passionate about the things he teaches. Notes are required but he's a good lecturer so notes are easily obtained. He was my learning community's fav. BTW, he can rap too!

Personable, passionate, and relatable professor! Somewhat unorganized with class material, but will always clarify if you request further explanation. His transparency of his urban low-class childhood may come off as intimidating to some. WILL TAKE AGAIN! I did gained TONS of useful knowledge of interconnected global challenges that I've overlooked
